title: 112_s1484
content: The Act is titled the "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" and prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions while providing conscience protections in a new chapter added to Title 1 of the United States Code. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" includes provisions such as prohibiting funding for abortions, health benefits plans covering abortion, limitations on Federal facilities and employees, and treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits funding for abortions and health benefits plans covering abortion. No government discrimination against certain health care entities is allowed. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits the use of federal funds for abortions and health benefits plans that cover abortion. It also restricts the use of federal funds for health benefits coverage that includes abortion and limits health care services in facilities owned or operated by the government. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits federal funds from being used for health benefits coverage that includes abortion. It also limits abortion in health care services provided by federal facilities or employees. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits federal funds from being used for health benefits coverage that includes abortion. However, individuals, entities, or states can purchase separate abortion coverage using non-Federal funds as long as no Federal funds are involved. The chapter does not restrict non-Federal health benefits coverage providers from offering abortion coverage as long as only non-Federal funds are used. Matching funds required for federally subsidized programs cannot be used for purchasing abortion coverage. Sec. 306. Non-preemption of other Federal laws: This chapter does not affect any other Federal law limiting the use of funds for abortion or health benefits coverage that includes abortion. Sec. 307 states that this chapter does not apply to treating complications from abortions, regardless of whether the abortion was performed in accordance with federal or state law. Sec. 308 exempts abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother from the limitations set in sections 301, 302, and 303. Sec. 308 exempts abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother from limitations. Sec. 309 applies to the District of Columbia, including funds appropriated by Federal law. Sec. 309 of the chapter applies to the District of Columbia, including funds approved by Congress. Sec. 310 prohibits government discrimination against certain health care entities. Sec. 310 prohibits government discrimination against certain health care entities, stating that no government entity can discriminate against health care providers for not providing, paying for, covering, or referring for abortions. The section prohibits discrimination by government entities against health care providers who do not provide, pay for, cover, or refer for abortions. Health care entity is broadly defined to include various health care professionals, facilities, and organizations. The courts have jurisdiction to address violations of this section. The courts of the United States have jurisdiction to prevent and address violations of the section prohibiting discrimination by government entities against health care providers who do not provide, pay for, cover, or refer for abortions. Legal or equitable relief, including injunctions and orders withholding Federal financial assistance, can be issued to enforce compliance. The courts have jurisdiction to prevent violations of the section prohibiting discrimination against health care providers who do not provide abortions. Legal relief, including withholding Federal financial assistance, can be issued to enforce compliance. An action under this subsection may be initiated by a health care entity or the Attorney General of the United States. The Secretary of Health and Human Services administers this section. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to receive and investigate complaints alleging violations of the section prohibiting discrimination against health care providers who do not provide abortions. The Attorney General may also coordinate in the investigation of such complaints. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to investigate complaints related to Federal agencies or programs.
